questions.question_text: Which of the following would NOT be a reason to activate a BCDR strategy?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Answer is A
The OSG says it's governance on page 20. Auditability is a subset of governance. But like with many of these situations, the "right" answer is not necessarily the "correct" answer.

comments.content: The answer should be governance as stated by the definition

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Answer is A

Selected Answer: A
Answer is A. Governance.
i think its A

Selected Answer: A
Its A!

Regulatory Compliance:
Regulatory compliance is an organization’s requirement to adhere to relevant laws, regulations, guidelines, and specifications relevant to its business, specifically dictated by 
the nature, operations, and functions it provides or utilizes to its customers.

Governance role is to set the directions in form of policies, standards, and guidelines. Management role is delivery based on processes & procedures that follow the policies, standards, and guidelines. Audit role is to review & inspect that delivery conforms to the policies, standards, and guidelines. Thus, answer is D & not A.
It says oversight.. which is governance. Auditing is not oversight.. but then it says “ensuring their compliance..” that would be audit. I’d still pick D
It says oversight.. which is governance. Auditing is not oversight.. but when the

Auditability allows for users and the organization to access, report, and obtain evidence of
actions, controls, and processes that were performed or run by a specified user.

D is correct:
Cloud Cross-Cutting Aspects: These cross-cutting aspects include security, interoperability, portability, reversibility, privacy, availability, governance, performance, service levels, service level agreements, auditability and regulatory aspects

Why B - Regulatory Requirements is not the answer? 
Regulatory requirements are also related to regulation, policy and compliance.

Auditability isn't one of the cross cutting aspects. They are:

Security, Interoperability, Portability, Reversibility, Privacy, Availability and Governance

Correct answer: D

Most leading cloud providers supply their customers with a good deal of auditing,
including reports and evidence that show user activity, compliance with controls and
regulations, systems and processes that run and an explanation of what they do, as well
as information, data access, and modification records.

comments.content: Audits are done to make sure controls and processes do what they are supposed to do, and that the Org is compliant with regulations.

discussion.content: Why not A - Governance?

questions.question_text: Which of the cloud cross-cutting aspects relates to the oversight of processes and systems, as well as to ensuring their compliance with specific policies and regulations?
